title: A pancakes and prosecco party is coming to Manchester for one week only
text:
A pancakes and prosecco party is coming to Manchester for one week only The pancake party features lemon cheesecake and banana split specials Share Get What's On updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
It's the best flippin' news of the week - a Manchester restaurant is about to throw a week long pancakes and prosecco party. 
The humble pancake usually gets just one day a year in its honour - Shrove Tuesday , which this year falls on February 28. 
But one Manchester restaurant is extending its moment of glory by laying on a decadent week of indulgent pancakes served up with a glass of prosecco. 
The Annual Pancake Party event is hosted by national chain Bill's, which has a restaurant on John Dalton Street, and features a variety of new toppings and fillings all served with a pile of buttermilk pancakes. 
You can get free prosecco and beer at Common in the Northern Quarter 
At brunch, lunch, and dinner time, the pancakes and prosecco combinations available will include the Lemon Cheesecake with vanilla ice cream and maple syrup, and the Banana Split stack of caramelized banana, a trio of strawberry, chocolate, and vanilla ice cream, three sauces (dark chocolate, salted caramel, and strawberry sauce) and a whipped cream topping. 
The pancakes and prosecco event begins on February 20 and runs until February 28, and diners can bag themselves this feast from £10 with a voucher from the official Bill's Restaurant website (not valid February 25-26). Read More Ferrero Rocher inspired BEER is coming to Manchester 
On pancake day, all dinners will also get to take home a jar of Bill's lemon curd and the recipe to recreate the restaurant's buttermilk pancakes at home. 
Pancakes served without prosecco are £5.95 for lemon cheesecake, £6.50 for salted caramel, and £6.95 for banana split. They are available with prosecco daily from midday. Read More
